author: {'steamid': '76561198090450195', 'num_games_owned': 1168, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 394, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 305, 'last_played': 1469160748}
review:
I sincerely don't understand the hate for this game. The story is interesting but all but destroyed by the bad dialogue. And the cinematics are pretty corny. Rather then cutscenes, you get still images of the characters with only they're mouths moving. It looks pretty funny.

But the game switches between "I, Spy" or "hidden object" sections (where you're told what items you're supposed to be looking for) and various puzzler, minigames. And the gameplay is solid.

There are some minigames that I feel should offer an explanation, for instance, on a couple levels you play the board game "Mastermind". If you've never heard of that game, it's nearly impossible to guess what to do without a guide.

If you're looking for a straight forward HOG to casually waste some time wih I absolutely recommend this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013070116', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 116, 'last_played': 1468632164}
review:
I got this for peanuts as part of a bundle and I still don't think it was worth it.

This "remaster" is a joke.

Talking faces done by such primitive image stratching that they're more creepy than realistic in any way.

Dialogue spoken by the wrong person... and I do mean spoken, like it was mislabeled, got recorded wrong and someone thought "eh, screw it" and put it in anyway. Very glaring.

Hidden object scenes where the inserted object have clearly different resolution from the background, making them stand out. Come on, that was excusable like 10 years ago. Plus generally low resolution in some scenes. I thought remasters were supposed to improve stuff?

Objectives referring to stuff I have yet to learn I need.

Puzzle descriptions missing.

Every single problem mentioned above happened multiple times.



I don't know what happened and it's very surprising to see such shoddy job from Artifex Mundi, but I'll be wary of any other possible "remasters". -2/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997098607', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1468024368}
review:
Terrible game.  

- Hidden object scenes are of poor quality, making me pixel hunt for objects.  
- Objects are also hidden by same colors and shapes.  This type of hiding felt cheap.  
- Not naturally wide screen, so game was stretched.

The only things remastered are the scenes outside of finding objects, which was pointless.  

+ Most of the voice acting is good, except for the antagonist.  He was terrible.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037716914', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 248, 'last_played': 1467997057}
review:
The premise here is not well-earned, but is a decent excuse to have you jumping all over various time periods. Unfortunately, nothing else about this game can be recommended. The writing and voice acting are terrible. As for the gameplay - and I say this as a fan of the genre and casual games generally - it is streamlined to a fault. The next thing you need to do is always right in front of you, with no backtracking or exploration. The items you pick up are immediately used in the same or very next room, so you never have to wonder when and how to use certain items. Heck, even the HO scenes themselves are less engaging than usual, because you never have to combine or manipulate objects.

There's three hours of tepid, on-rails entertainment here, but there are just so many better examples of the genre that it's impossible to recommend this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991692170', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 303, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 335, 'last_played': 1467561775}
review: One of the earlier games of Artifex Mundi from what I gathered and it shows. The art isn't very good and the objects are sometimes hard to see. But even so, you can click yourself to victory and the game provided what I was looking for, a relaxing HO experience with not too hard puzzles. Their newer games are much better obviously but even so, I recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032373667', 'num_games_owned': 540, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 506, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 506, 'last_played': 1467468949}
review:
This is the earliest of Artifex Mundiâ€™s games available on Steam at the time of this posting (original release 2010), although it is the remastered edition. I never played the original release, so I canâ€™t comment on the changes that occurred in this edition.

I do give it a recommend with the caveat that it doesn't work as a standalone game. Without the other games in the trilogy to tie up the loose ends in the story, it falls flat on its face. However, if you're a completionist like me who likes that sort of complexity, and you're a fan of Artifex Mundi's other works, the trilogy is worth a playthrough.

In terms of gameplay and mechanics you can see the bones of Artifex Mundi's success, but it's definitely lacking polish and can lead to frustration particularly if you're not familiar with how their games work. Some of the graphic design/art decisions also contribute to that. I do like the music, but the voice actor for Michael is hilariously awful.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007607571', 'num_games_owned': 862, 'num_reviews': 135, 'playtime_forever': 227, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 227, 'last_played': 1467490192}
review:
I've got Time Mysteries: Inheritance - Remastered in my Artifex Mundi bundle. After throughly enjoying Dark Arcana: Carnival, I've installed this game because - time travel. There are certain topics that excite me, and time traveling (alongside multiple universes) is one of them.

What I've encountered is a game that easily falls in the category of one of my worst gaming experiences. By the end of second hour, I've decided I don't want to risk my sight and sanity and I've finished the game by using hint system, randomly clicking and skipping minigames.

Mechanically, it is typical Artifex Mundi game where you need to find hidden objects and solve easy-as-pie puzzles while playing minigames. You can skip minigames if you find 'em hard (or awful to look at, if you're like me) and you can play Match-3 type of game instead of finding hidden objects. If you've ever laid your hands on any of Artifex Mundi games, you know the drill.

However, this game fails horribly at any other aspect. The story is lazy excuse of a plot. I am a huge fan of b-movies, but this thing really doen't even cut it as cute and/or funny. Characters are horrible, plot holes are HUGE (with some plot lost in their darkness) and game simply don't make you care about anything story-wise. I am not expecting H.G.Wells nor Arthur C. Clarke here, but hey, a decent writer could be hired (wink, wink, hint system is on).

The remastered version of the game is horrid. Sounds, occassional music clips and voices can pass if you're really ignorant. Even crappy animation can stand tall compared to complete and utterly disastrous HOG scenes. Scenes are blurry, low resolution. Colors are confusing. Some scenes hidden objects are in obvious contrast so you can easily click your way through the scene without even trying to read what you are looking for. Believe me, I don't even want to know what original game looked like if this is REMASTERED version.

To sum it all up, this is lame excuse for HOG and you shouldn't play nor buy it. Take good care of your three hours you could easily waste and never get back in case you decide to ignore my warning. 

***

Hey, you've liked this review? Hated it? It made you buy the game / abandon the idea of buying this game? Super awesome! Share the love and join the group here: http://steamcommunity.com/groups/libereviews Follow the curator's page here: http://store.steampowered.com/curator/10953338/

review:
Es sind bereits einige nicht besonders gute Wimmelbildspiele durch meine Finger gewandert, aber dieses hat sich den Platz auf der Liste echt hart erkÃ¤mpft. 

[b]Pro:[/b]
[list][*]viele Wimmelbildszenen[/list]

[b]Kontra[/b]
[list][*]zusammengebastelte, uninteressante Geschichte
[*]teils gruselige Grafiken
[*]RÃ¤tsel nicht nennenwert
[/list]

Das die erzÃ¤hlten Geschichten nicht der Kracher sind, ist in diesem Genre fast zu erwarten. Bei "Time Mysteries: Inheritance" wirkte das Setting erzwungen und lose zusammengeflickt um irgendwie die Wimmelbilder in einen Kontext zu setzen. Die Vertonung war schlicht zum Weglaufen und ich habe sie nach einer Viertelstunde zusammen mit der Musik abgedreht und stattdessen nebenbei Videos laufen lassen. Eigentlich hÃ¤tte man die ganzen Cutscenes direkt skippen kÃ¶nnen, man verpasst nichts.

Die QualitÃ¤t der Szenen ist auch nicht besonders gut, in einer konnte man zum Bleispiel die gesuchten Objekte einfach daran erkennen, dass ihre AuflÃ¶sung deutlich hÃ¶her war, als die des Hintergrunds.

Ich habe mir das Spiel im Pack mit den anderen beiden Spielen der Reihe gekauft, auf Grund der Reviews hÃ¤tte ich sonst darauf verzichtet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024973406', 'num_games_owned': 1127, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 243, 'last_played': 1467357283}
review: Low res, not difficult, some of the puzzles had this weird pulsing bright light thing that hurt my eyes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028570547', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2563, 'playtime_forever': 343, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 343, 'last_played': 1467288881}
review:
"Time Mysteries: Inheritance - Remastered" oder auf deutsch auch "RÃ¤tsel der Zeit: Das Erbe" genannt ist ein klassisches Wimmelbildspiel.

Wir sind Vivien Ambrose, eine junge Physikerin, der dummerweise der Vater entfÃ¼hrt wurde. Um ihn aufzuspÃ¼ren bedarf es der Hilfe einer Kristallkugel, sieben magischen Ringen und natÃ¼rlich Reisen durch die Zeit. 

Mit Logik hat dieses Wimmelbildspiel offenbar nichts am Hut. Funktioniert es denn zumindest? An sich schon, technisch gesehen zumindest. Das Problem: "Time Mysteries" ist unfaÃŸbar leicht. Wimmelbildspiele sind ja an sich schon nicht gerade skillnotwendig, aber bei diesem Spiel hat man so gar keine Herausforderung. 

Die Idee mit den Zeitreisen, durch die man in verschiedenen Epochen spielt, ist an sich ganz nett, aber jede Zeitreise lÃ¤uft im Prinzip immer wieder gleich ab. Dabei nehmen die Wimmelbildspiele an sich groÃŸen Raum ein, zwischen die Geschichten eingestreut werden noch simple RÃ¤tsel- oder Verschiebepuzzles und hat man dann den Ring, gibts noch ein Finde-die-sieben-Unterschiede-in-zwei-fast-identischen-Bildern. SpÃ¤testens nach der dritten Epoche ist man von der RepetetivitÃ¤t angenervt.

Die Grafik wÃ¤re okay, wÃ¤re sie nicht gelegentlich recht unscharf, so als kÃ¤me die AuflÃ¶sung nicht ganz mit. Schade auch, daÃŸ man in den Wimmelbildern mit etwas Ãœbung die zu findenden GegenstÃ¤nde recht leicht erkennt, weil sie teiks erkennbar auf das Bild aufgesetzt wirken. 

Und die Zwischensequenzen? Sind zumindest alle vertont, teils sogar mit einer ganz netten selbstironischen Haltung. Irritierend lÃ¤cherlich wirken allerdings die Animationen. Fehlende Mimik wird einfach dadurch kompensiert, daÃŸ Gesichtspartien gedehnt oder gestaucht werden. Ziemlich albern.

[h1]Wertung:[/h1]
4/10 AtmosphÃ¤re
5/10 Story
4/10 Grafik
4/10 Sound
5/10 Spielmechanik
2/10 Balancing
4/10 Spielspass

[h1]Fazit:[/h1]
Schwaches, repetetives und viel zu einfaches Wimmelbildgeklicke. 

[h1][b]4/10 Gesamtwertung

author: {'steamid': '76561197963905026', 'num_games_owned': 3642, 'num_reviews': 411, 'playtime_forever': 497, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 497, 'last_played': 1467051724}
review:
I enjoy hidden object games and other casual BS, and I've played a lot of them.  This one is about the worst of the worst, even after being remastered.  Surprising since Artifex Mundi usually releases good products.  

The good:
-It has hidden object scenes and light puzzles
-The language is fine, there aren't (m)any wrongly-named objects/translations
-The achievements all function and you can get them all in a single playthrough

The bad:
-The graphics in some areas are just plain HORRIBLE.  For a hidden object game, where the focus is the visuals (as opposed to gameplay, story, etc) that's a huge downfall.  
-The story and voice-acting are dumb, but I think that's to be expected in this genre
-It's entirely linear, there's no earning items then returning to a previous area etc.  Unless 2 adjacent rooms counts for that...

Here's hoping #2 is better, because I'm about to start that!

author: {'steamid': '76561198051193585', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 180, 'last_played': 1466451154}
review:
This game needs to be "remastered" a second time.
They should have tossed this one in the trash and called it "practice".
Its only redeeming quality is that it is possible to get a perfect game in only one playthrough.
Having to play this twice would be cruel and unusual.
Pulsing light in hidden object puzzles should be punishable by death! :D
Waterfalls too, *cough* GL3 ...

author: {'steamid': '76561198072002990', 'num_games_owned': 1618, 'num_reviews': 122, 'playtime_forever': 289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 289, 'last_played': 1465879905}
review: Cute game! I liked the story line. One of the characters was a little weird but it added to the charm. Puzzles weren't totally easy, 100% the game after 4.5 hours. It was enjoyable.. I've always loved these games :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197987358915', 'num_games_owned': 3006, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 398, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 398, 'last_played': 1465757901}

author: {'steamid': '76561198052965201', 'num_games_owned': 1046, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 181, 'last_played': 1526657771}
review: Another nice little puzzler from Artifex Mundi, this one spanning several time periods. Varied mini-games are included and the hidden-object-games are kind of challenging, but doable. (Still not a fan of time travel though.)

author: {'steamid': '76561197998646161', 'num_games_owned': 2355, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 300, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 300, 'last_played': 1465437595}
review:
Decent hidden object game with some interresting design choices. 

Poor animation with odd facial movements,  especially when talking. 

The puzzles are mostly find 10 items or spot 7 differences. 

Good hint system and a dedicated skip button on some puzzles. 

Fairly short.

Full voice acting,  which I didnt listen to very much of because it is never my cup of tea.

Some items are incredibly hard to see.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080001787', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 444, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 384, 'last_played': 1464544607}
review:
I'm a fan of point and click / hidden objects games but 'Time Mysteries: Inheritance - Remastered', along with 'Dark Heritage: Guardians of Hope', is one of the weakest out there. Initially the only good thing was the music but even that gets annoying after awhile.

The characters look awful when they speak. For example, Vivien, which is the main character, looks like a fish when she talks. Apart from that, the hidden object scenes are horrible on the eyes!  I had trouble finding a few items because I just couldn't make them out, they were that blurred. Oh and did I mention that some hidden objects' scene glow?! I'm not sure what they were thinking when they decided to add this feature but it sucks!

The "find the difference" games are also painful on the eyes, they are small and also not as clear as they could be. At least for me.

Overall the game gets really repetitive regarding what you have to do to advance.

This game was in a bundle that I bought for really cheap. I don't advise you to buy it.

Such a shame.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995094876', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 198, 'last_played': 1463864326}
review:
- Ich habe das Spiel auf 'Normal', 100%, ohne Guide und ohne Ãœberspringen durchgespielt. Ich werde das Spiel auch dementsprechend bewerten.

Ich werde mir mit diesem Review wahrscheinlich keine Freunde machen, aber dieses Spiel ist eines der frustrierensten, langweiligsten und overall schlechtesten HOG's auf Steam. 
Ich habe bereits viele HOG's gespielt und einige sogar perfektioniert (100%) und kann daher reinen Gewissens sagen, dass dieses Spiel in einer der unteren Schubladen landet. 

Warum das? Bittesehr:

- Der Schwierigkeitsgrad ist BEI WEITEM zu hoch. Sowohl fÃ¼r Menschen, die bei solchen Spielen abschalten mÃ¶chten (Casual-Gamer) als auch fÃ¼r HOG-Veteranen ist das Spiel an mehreren Stellen weder unterhaltsam noch herausfordernd. 
   ----- Viele der Wimmelbild-Szenen sind so vollgestopft mit GegenstÃ¤nden, dass man viele Items, die man zum Weiterspielen finden muss (die btw. meistens in der Hintergrundfarbe gehalten sind) einfach unsichtbar werden. Durch diese kann man sich zwar auf "Normal" ohne Strafe durchklicken (was bei den Ã¼berwiegend winzigkleinen Items wie "Stift", "BÃ¼roklammer" und "MarienkÃ¤fer" nicht wirklich hilft), so aber nicht bei....
  ----- ... den RÃ¤tseln. EInige der RÃ¤tsel sind trotz Strategie und Verstand beinahe unknackbar. Um euch ein Beispiel zu geben, zitiere ich hier mal einen Diskussionsthread-Ersteller, welcher seinen Post "That bloody rune game in the 7th Century" getauft hat. Dieses RÃ¤tsel ist ein sogenanntes "Lights Out Puzzle", welches Ecken und Kanten hat. Das macht das ganze in meinen Augen zu schwer.

- Manche HO-Szenen sind alles andere als hochauflÃ¶send.
- Die Synchronstimmen sind unterirdisch schlecht.
- Die Story ist... nicht gut. Belassen wir es dabei...
- Man tut neben den HO-Szenen und den RÃ¤tseln leider immer dasselbe. Man verbringt mindestens 60% vom Spiel in diesem "Raum der Zeit".
- Das Preis-LeistungsverhÃ¤ltnis ist bestenfalls 'noch ausreichend' (4-)

+/- Man kann so gesehen nicht sterben/verlieren
+/- Es gibt zwei Schwierigkeitsgrade
+/- Das Steam-Overlay funktioniert
+/- Achievements + Sammelkarten

+ Die Musik ist wirklich Ã¼berragend. Eine Schande, dass Artifex Mundi bisher keinen OST-DLC freigeschaltet hat.
+ Viele der SchauplÃ¤tze sehen wirklich super aus. Mir hat das Mittelalter zum Beispiel sehr gut gefallen.



Dieses Spiel sticht negativ unter allen anderen HOGs hervor - und das ist ziemlich schade, weil es sich bei "Time Mysteries" um einen Dreiteiler handelt. Dieses Spiel ist definitiv das Schlechteste unter den dreien (und das sage ich, obwohl ich den zweiten Teil zum jetzigen Zeitpunkt noch gar nicht angerÃ¼hrt habe). Das Spiel bleibt bis zum Ende langweilig, trÃ¤ge, eintÃ¶nig und zum Ende hin sogar lachhaft aufgrund der Story und der Vertonung.


Solltet ihr nach einem guten HOG suchen, probiert "Clockwork Tales: Of Glass and Ink" (auf Steam erhÃ¤ltlich), "Robin's Quest" (auf Steam erhÃ¤ltlich), â€Alchemy Mysteries: Prague Legendsâ€œ (auf Steam erhÃ¤ltlich), "Mystery of Mortlake Mansion" oder "Luxor Adventures".

Tut euch selber einen Gefallen und macht einen groÃŸen Bogen um "Time Mysteries: Inheritance - Remastered".



PS: Wo auch immer dieses "Remastered" herkommt...........

Fazit: 3/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198277771100', 'num_games_owned': 221, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1521270053}
review: The graphics and illustrations are terrible, which made me have a lot of trouble solving some of the image-based puzzles. The character dialogue is childish and boring, the music is so-so, and the plot is boring. The only interesting part of the game was the time museum itself, which does not make up for what the rest of the game lacks. In my opinion, skip this game and go straight to the second installment in the series. This first one only connects to the second in that the main character is the same. That is seriously the only connection, you're not going to miss anything by going straight to the second one. However, I do really recommend the rest of the series, it is so much better than this one, I'm truly amazed by how bad this one is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008914127', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 145, 'playtime_forever': 274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1618066213}
review: I love Artiflex Mundi games but this one really isn't up to their standard. The game has a great premise but becomes annoying pretty quickly due to poor voice acting, repetitive hidden object, nonsensical storyline, and its habit of revealing your next action before you've even clicked on the environment to find out what to do. The minigames are much better but I was soon bored. A shame, but I presume it was one of their early ones so it's perhaps unfair to compare to some of their later and excellent games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062136790', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 229, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 229, 'last_played': 1463246500}
review: I liked the concept of this game - travelling through different times and having many different settings because of it. But in most of these settings you only had 2 or 3 scenes to explore, which made solving the puzzles both easy and usually boring. The characters were animated rather poorly and I would have prefered static 2D graphics rather than this, the voice acting was also poor, but I did enjoy the story. Still, I wouldn't recommend the game. There are plenty of better games like this out there.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991391480', 'num_games_owned': 329, 'num_reviews': 219, 'playtime_forever': 252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 186, 'last_played': 1483898547}
review:
Poorly made. Even by the low standards of the Hidden Object Game genre, the writing, dialogue, voice acting, and animations are awful. Most of the Hidden Object Puzzles take place under this weird, pulsing light that is really distracting and the mini-game instructions are hidden.

 just overall poorly made, hidden puzzle instructions, weird hop lighting.

review:
[h1] Genre [/h1] Ein Hidden Object Adventure

[h1] Story [/h1] Wir spielen eine Junge Frau namens "Vivien Ambrose" und gehen zum Haus unseres Vaters um mit ihm zusammen einen Beruflichen Erfolg zu feiern. Dort angekommen finden wir einen Brief wo drinne steht das Unser Vater von einem Zeitreisenden EntfÃ¼hrt wurde. Jetzt wollen wir ihn natÃ¼rlich retten

[h1] Gameplay [/h1] Wir klicken uns von Szene zu Szene und lÃ¶sen Wimmelbilder und verschiedene RÃ¤tsel. Zudem sammeln wir GegenstÃ¤nde die wir dann zum weiterkommen an bestimmten Stellen einsetzen

[h1] Achievements [/h1] Es gibt insgesamt 10 Erfolge. Man kann alle in einem Durchgang schaffen. Man muss das Spiel einfach beenden ohne Tipps einzusetzen und ohne Minispiele zu Ã¼berspringen

[h1] Pro/Contra [/h1]
+ Story ganz OK
+ Grafik ganz Gut
+ Gute Musik
+ Sound OK
+ Achievements
+ Sammelkarten

[h1] Fazit [/h1] Ein sehr gutes Hidden Object Adventure. FÃ¼r Fans von Wimmelbild Spielen auf jeden Fall sehr zu Empfehlen

author: {'steamid': '76561198059305397', 'num_games_owned': 7033, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 374, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 328, 'last_played': 1461399262}
review:
[h1]The worst...[/h1]

[b]Gameplay: 2 / 10[/b] - Boring, awkward, odd, without sense

[b]Story: 1 / 10[/b] - I must stick it with logic part. There is not any logic in this game.

[b]Music: 4 / 10[/b] - most of the time it was not fitting and was very irritating. But 2 or 3 times it was "ok".

[b]HOG: 2 / 10[/b] - 60% of items was drawed another way than the background, it was hard not to spot them.... AND SPOONS.... That ducking spoons... Almost in every HOG segment over there you must find one...

[b]Puzzles: 1 / 10[/b] - maybe it is a game for players under the age of 12?

[b]Using items puzzles: 1 / 10[/b] - maxium items you could have is 4 I think and there was a 3 clickable / usable spots to click in the location. So... meh... babywork...

[b]Locations: 1 / 10[/b] - you can be only at 1 location divided to 2 "rooms" at a time. If you finish them, you can only leave the place and find 2 another, from another timeline. 

[b]Ending: 1 / 10[/b] - We must do X! Ok, then I will go to some random location (why not?), do random stuff (hehe) and finally - don't do X, but do Y. THE END (WHAT?!)

[b]Protagoist: 1 / 10[/b] - irritating, not convincing and likeable and the most important - "Timetravels? Yeah, cool" Nobody would stick into a kidnapping a father and discover a time travels in a matter of seconds...

[b]Logic: 1 / 10[/b] - 2 most imporant issues: time travel + "you are here too late". Second one (spoiler): [SPOILER]"my time travel device is broken, I can travel anywhere, anytime and I don't even know when -> travel exactly where he needs and always before us[/SPOILER]

[b]Duration: ? / 10[/b] - I can't rate this becasue of too much hate.

[b]Achievements: 7 / 10[/b] - pretty standard GOOD ones. I appreciate the "hard difficulty" of not using any help or be quick in some situations. 

[h1][b]Overall: 22 / 120 (18%)[/b][/h1]

[h1]Personally I would rate this game exactly 18% :/
This was terrbile and I hate to know - my addiction of completion is leading me to 2 sequels...[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561197994587525', 'num_games_owned': 1937, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 172, 'last_played': 1459799573}
review:
I can't get over how ugly all the characters in this game is. The animations are really weird and just look like they're morphing the static character portraits - well, I suppose that is actually what's going on.

Complete hidden-object puzzles to unlock new time periods; solve easy puzzles in the time period to progress the story. Quite standard.

If you buy it, wait for a sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080724645', 'num_games_owned': 3618, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 204, 'last_played': 1461260803}
review:
- This review isn't written by a native speaker, thank you for your understanding -

- If you haven't found this review helpful or if you have found a mistake please leave a comment below -

[h1][b]Rating[/b][/h1] between Fine and Good.

[h1]- Key features below ---- Review after -----------------------------------------------[/h1]

[h1][b]Play time needed (perfect)[/b][/h1] about 3 hours (story mode only)
[h1][b]Gaming level[/b][/h1] Casual
[h1][b]Achievement level[/b][/h1] Casual
[h1][b]Game style[/b][/h1] Hidden object; Puzzle; Point n' Click (First person view)
[h1][b]Game modes[/b][/h1] Story mode, Bonus story mode
[h1][b]Graphics[/b][/h1] Fine. (If you like the old style)
[h1][b]Story[/b][/h1] Fine.
[h1][b]Playthrough[/b][/h1] One.
[h1][b]Voice[/b][/h1] Fine.
[h1][b]Music[/b][/h1] Good.
[h1][b]Controls[/b][/h1] Mouse only.
[h1][b]Tutorial[/b][/h1] Yes.
[h1][b]Unmissable / backtracking content[/b][/h1] No, refer to (*) at the end.
[h1][b]Glitches / bugs[/b][/h1] None.
[h1][b]Worth price[/b][/h1] Half price, because even remastered that's still an old game.

[h1]- Review below ----------------------------------------------------------------------[/h1]

Artifex Mundi sp. z o.o. made for the first time a remastered edition for this game and made a sequel for it. The sequel will have almost the same mechanics and improved features but will not have the 7 difference mini-game and sonar.

The story is good and graphics are fine.

According to me there is much more hidden objects scenes than puzzle. Puzzle are so-so and not so hard or challenging. Finally the game features an inventory where you can store items to combine with the environment to go deeper in the story. 

The game have two difficulties and have a guest feature : all the family can play the game and resume it where they left.
 
Also you can use the Hint/Skip hourglass whenever you want and wait until its refill to use it again. But be warned that you may not skip any puzzle or use hint in hidden objects scene if you wish to have some achievements.

The good thing is you got a sonar for the hidden object scenes which will show you the shape of the item's name you point. (Perhaps it's only available is the easiest mode) Whenever game you played you can also switch to a match-3 mini game instead of the hidden objects scene but I guess that you won't got the achievement for the hidden objects scenes.

In this game there is a kind of ritual to be able to travel time, you need to place a magical ring then find the difference between two scenes after that you need to retrieve a list of objects of this century in a hidden objects scene to finally put them in the machine to open the door of the related period.


(*) :
The game has some achievements that can be missed they are mostly challenging achievements. 

The challenging achievements require you to finish a puzzle or a hidden objects scene game under a minute. And two achievements require you to find 3 objects in 3 seconds or find all objects with a few misclicks in the hidden object scenes. Have I already said you need to not skip any puzzle and to not use any hint in the hidden objects scene.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030080447', 'num_games_owned': 1283, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 314, 'last_played': 1460570768}
review:
It feels weird to give a game developed by Artifex Mundi a negative review, but sadly this is by far the worst game by these developers I've ever played. By concept and gameplay it's a standard Hidden Object aka Adventure-light game, with a rather bland story, lots of Hidden Object-screens and quite some (often very illogical) puzzles added into the mix. The story isn't very convincing, but it's not that bad and could support a game if the rest was executed with the high standards we've come to expect from Artifex Mundi. Sadly, this isn't the case: the visuals aren't appealing (even downright ugly in some places), the voice-acting is terrible and most important of all: the hidden object-scenes miss the mark by far. Quite often the different objects are almost impossible to spot due to their disappearing into the blurry visuals, or they simply don't match the description given. And the seven screens or so situated in the museum (the central hub of the game) are hampered by a pulsing light that gave me a headache while looking for the hidden objects.

Since this is one of the earliest games by Artifex Mundi on Steam, it probably isn't wise to compare it with their later, much more polished offerings, but just taken on its own merits, the game fails to deliver. Normally, hidden object games give a fine opportunity to score a "perfect game" as far as Steam achievements are concerned, but I gave up on this one in the end, and decided to quit it before finishing it. Happily, the later installments in this mini-series are MUCH better, and a game like this actually helps to appreciate the increase in quality Artifex Mundi has achieved since then.

[b]Not recommended, unless you really want to play every single Hidden Object Game on Steam.[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198018061433', 'num_games_owned': 1510, 'num_reviews': 1588, 'playtime_forever': 197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 197, 'last_played': 1460576063}

Im Game reisen wir in verschiedene Zeitepochen um Ringe zu finden. Diese Epochen Ã¶ffnen sich wenn wir GegenstÃ¤nde von ihr in einem Wimmelbild finden. Dort  warten Mini Games und Aufgaben auf uns, um einen Ring zu finden. Das ist die Kurzfassung. Das Gameplayprinzip bleibt bis zum Ende gleich.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072027162', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1460293907}
review: About middle of the pack when it comes to HOG games.  Very good hidden object portions, fairly bland story but enough to keep me going. Love the bizzare looking facial animations (just because they look so weird).  Not a lot of variety in the other puzzles, but there were no real "stumpers".   If you like this type game, it gets a thumbs up from me. (Certainly wait for a sale of course...).  Not much replay value in this one so plan on about 3-4 hours of play.

review:
[h1]Los efectos de la radiaciÃ³n humana A.C.[/h1]

Ya sabemos que los juegos de este tipo nunca serÃ¡n grandes obras maestras, pero el gÃ©nero en sÃ­ entretiene bastante, relaja y da un toque de energÃ­a a los engranajes de tu cerebro. AdemÃ¡s las historias de estos juegos son un aliciente que ayuda a continuar. 

Desgraciadamente este juego en concreto no tiene nada bueno: mala resoluciÃ³n hasta el punto de escenas borrosas que parecen corrosivas, historia cutre de principio a fin, animaciones pÃ©simas ya que los movimientos faciales se basan en deformaciones al lÃ­mite irritantes para la vista, como si se tratase de un cruel homenaje a los afectados de la radiaciÃ³n de ChernÃ³bil. El estilo artÃ­stico es muy feo y simplÃ³n, los puzles repetitivos y bÃ¡sicos que no concuerdan con lo que se nos cuenta en cada momento. Es un juego sin ningÃºn carisma, la duraciÃ³n es muy corta comparada con otros.
Me paro detenidamente a pensar algo bueno y se me paralizan los dedos para teclear.

[i]Time Mysterioes Inheritance[/i] es el peor juego "busca objetos" que he jugado hasta el dÃ­a de hoy. En el trailer parece un juego aceptable pero la realidad es totalmente distinta. Cualquier otro de este estilo es mejor. EstÃ¡s avisado: no gastes tu dinero aquÃ­.

[b]Lo mejor[/b]: al menos estÃ¡ subtitulado al castellano. Es corto y el sufrimiento dura poco.
[b]Lo peor[/b]: todo el juego entero.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043495274', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 339, 'playtime_forever': 223, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 223, 'last_played': 1459616642}
review:
Hidden object tout ce qu'il y a de plus classique que je ne recommande pas pour les simples et bonnes raisons suivantes

Le jeu tout entier se dÃ©finit en une Ã©tape qui se rÃ©pÃ¨te pour finalement trouver sept bagues :
SOC  -> nouveau lieu (puzzles / Ã©nigmes / soc)  -> bague  -> jeu des 7 diffÃ©rences et on recommence.

Les SOC sont peu Ã©videntes Ã  cause d'effets (flou / jeu de lumiÃ¨re) Ã§a m'a plus filÃ© la migraine qu'autre chose.
Graphismes relativement bof pour un scÃ©nario qui a Ã©tÃ© ajoutÃ© juste pour border. 
Un peu trop plat et linÃ©aire Ã  mon goÃ»t...

Dommage parce qu'il y a nÃ©anmoins de bonnes idÃ©es avec le retour de dÃ©fis Ã  la Master Mind par exemple. 
Les diffÃ©rentes atmosphÃ¨res et Ã©poques sont bien suivies par le thÃ¨me musicale ou encore la base mÃªme des SOC et Ã§a j'y attache de l'importance mais Ã§a ne suffit pas Ã  en faire un bon jeu du genre. 

Ah et allez savoir pourquoi, ils ont fait un focus sur les cuilliÃ¨res, dans les SOC si vous en voyez une, n'hÃ©sitez pas !

SuccÃ¨s easy peasy Ã  collectionner.
Je vais enchainer le 2 & 3 pour me faire une idÃ©e.

author: {'steamid': '76561198194289627', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 54, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1459173815}
review:
This is a tough decision. On the one hand, it's not _bad_, but...

- an hour in and i've already noticed 3 or 4 spelling errors in the dialog. (In the Nightmares from the Deep trilogy i only noticed 2 in the whole series, and one of them might have been intentional pirate slang.)

- while the animated scenes look relatively modern/slick, the HO scenes are fairly grainy and appear to be from the 1990's, and it's essentially impossible to tell what certain items are (cufflinks? Really? a knight?). The relatively grainy graphics on the HO parts are leaving me second-guessing too often.

- One HO scene wants you to find a compass, but it's got 2 different once (but only one of them is valid). (Look carefully!)

- At least one flat out lie: "It looks just like the dresser in this room!" There _is_ no dresser in this room. That leaves me wondering how many more inaccuracies will be tripping me up along the way.

- Objective texts appearing before they should. "New Objective: Investigate the painting the ghost pointed to" is shown as the ghost appears but before it points to anything. Minor, but confusing nonetheless.

- None of the puzzles presented so far as _any_ explanatory text. Just start clicking until you figure it out. (Maybe hard-core puzzlers like that, but i don't.)


OTOH, i like the voice acting and the pacing.


i'm unfortunately forced to rate this a "thumbs down." This came in a set of episodes 1 to 3, so we'll just move on to part 2. Maybe some rainy day i'll revisit episode 1.

author: {'steamid': '76561198277011659', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1458949750}
review: I realize that this is an early game for Artifex Mundi, but this is just horrible. The art is okey, I guess, but it's in such low resolution that it makes it so much harder to spot things. They also for some unknown reason have a pulsating bright light in several of their hidden object parts that is just annoying. I can't believe that this is a "remaster" and have looked worse, with more misspelled words and in general bad and repetative puzzles (which you don't get an explanation in. Just a puzzle and nothing more) In a few puzzles it was harder to figure out what the point was than actually figuring out the answer to it. The only positive thing in this is the music, it really brought my rage down with soothing acoustic sounds. Artifex Mundi at least have learned from this and are now making good hidden object/puzzle games, which if you want one. Get one of their later ones. 3.3/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198165533399', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1459358942}
review:
That's a difficult game to rate. On one hand, it has quite likeable main character, plot and music. On the other, the grafics are uneven (certain objects and pieces of background looks like done in different resolutions and styles) and animation hurts my eyes - I can understand a bit to quick movements between close-ups, but when a character speaks in a cutscene it's face litteraly floats like poked water baloon! 

It's not a bad game over all, but one really can get a headache from this lightning and animation.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971490143', 'num_games_owned': 1321, 'num_reviews': 226, 'playtime_forever': 162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 162, 'last_played': 1458318404}
review: The game is good in the way that it works, but not much more. There are simply better HO games today. The gameplay is too linear and too repetitive. Some objects are uneccessarily hard to find. Later in the game, the graphics quality worsens and the game seems rushed. The quirky animation is funny at first, but later cringeworthy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076331843', 'num_games_owned': 1264, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 312, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 221, 'last_played': 1469595948}
review: I enjoy hidden object games, but this one I found annoying. Several of the hidden object scenes have lights that fade in and out, which is distracting. Also, the hidden object scenes have grainy pictures. The music got on my nerves as it was very repetitive, and not great to begin with. Plus, there are spot the difference scenes, which are very very annoying, as it is tough to find all of the differences; I found myself clicking all over the scene to just luck out spotting the difference.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961725944', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 311, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 158, 'last_played': 1518249794}
review:
Je ne comprends pas trop pourquoi ce jeu a des critiques nÃ©gatives. Il est pas mal fichu dans son genre. Ca reste du classique dans les objets cachÃ©s, et celui-lÃ  est mÃªme dans les plus sympas Ã  mon avis. 

De plus, il n'y a aucun bug et surtout, aucun problÃ¨me de traduction ce qui est le problÃ¨me que l'on peut trouver dans ce jeu et qui peut handicaper sa progression. Donc rien Ã  reprocher.

Je recommande, mais essayez de l'avoir en soldes, c'est encore mieux.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990811071', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 214, 'last_played': 1491076650}
review:
The overall review of mixed is understandable. The game itself is enjoyable. The usual hidden object game with puzzles. Oddly it gets easier at the end. But the cut scenes are terrible. The animation is some kind of wiggle headed mid 90's flash animation from the newgrounds portal. The voice acting is about 50/50. And it's poorly edited. Choppy. Cuts off to soon or comes in too early. I guess this is an updated version of the game. No idea what it was like before, but I have a feeling they should have left it alone.

But overlooking all the terrible aspects of the game that aren't actually the game, I would recommend buying the game next time it's on sale. It's a good time waster. A little too easy. But then again it is the first in the series.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009341354', 'num_games_owned': 1552, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 252, 'last_played': 1457308842}
review: I've played a lot of the Artifex Mundi HOD games.  This one just isn't good compared to the rest.  It might be "remastered" but really it is just fuzzy enlarged images that make it kind of hard to do the hidden object part of the game.  The story starts out fine and then kind of goes no where.  The acting in this one is all kinds of terrible. The puzzle in this are just not that intresting as there are very few inventory items as this game is told in very short vignettes.  Overall I just can't recomend this one.  Artifex Mundi's later games are far superior.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036810100', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 202, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 202, 'last_played': 1456122862}
review: I can't say the mechanics of this game were very good. one it constantly hints where you need to go. take the fun out of exploring, two it was very repetative no real exploring just find a ring differences find some object for machine go to time repeat 6 more times bleh!, three terrible lip syncing it got to the point I couldnt even stay with the story next time dont move the mouths gets the point across just as well, four the story wasn't very engaging honestly I got bored within the first 30 minutes of it it had no REAL mystery and the so called clues were optional to find. whats up with that?, five some of the things you needed to find wasnt specific enough or so unreasonalbly hidden there wouldve been no way for you to see it. ISPY knew how to stump on is this the right bat? well this had repeat offenders and it only wanted ONE of them. plus half the things supposedly really hidden were tiny lighting terrible to see and constant light flashing BLEH! BOtanica is way better don't waste your time

author: {'steamid': '76561198146196947', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 256, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 256, 'last_played': 1455821345}
review:
This is one of the games where Steam would need a "meh" option. The original game is pretty old and the Remaster doesn't help very much. The story and characters are badly written. It contains time travel and falls into every trap that stories about time travel will open. The voice actiong is sometimes laughably bad. The hidden object scenes vary very strongly in quality. The minigames are never explained but they do have a skip button in case you can't figure out what they want. 

HOWEVER, it is very interesting to play for people who are either interested in game development, or in the evolution of the genre HOG. Playing from this game, where I skipped a lot to the last game of the trilogy where I got all achievements because I was so engaged was a really interesting experience. It is amazing to see how bit by bit the developer evolved, How much they learned in every iteration and grew by actively trying to make their games better. This game really made me appreciate how much work Artifex Mundi puts into their games and how serious they take their work as artists! So even if I gave a thumbs down, because most people coming here will not appreciate that perspective and will prefer the later entries in the series, it was definitely a learning experience for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077817772', 'num_games_owned': 1626, 'num_reviews': 216, 'playtime_forever': 577, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 577, 'last_played': 1456004799}
review:
a casual adventure Hidden Object Game from Artifex Mundi to kill some free time, the plot is mediocre with some challenging puzzles and very good soundtracks + you got 10 easy achievements for achievements hunters
the only thing i dont like about the game is the price 9.99$ is a bit too much for it so i recommend to grab it on sales
7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198001760555', 'num_games_owned': 994, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 501, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 501, 'last_played': 1455995696}
review:
Well, my yes recommendation is a bit generous. HOGs are short (I have over 500 hours in Fallout 4), so provided you can get a reasonable price for the game then it is worth it.  I would say that no more than 5 bucks but preferrably in a bundle. However if you are a completionist like me and you have #2 and #3. Then 6 bucks would be okay -hey the price of a cheap matinee.

There are a couple problems with this old but updated title.  Even the updated grapics are subpar. I am not a graphics whore but when you make an HOG, your hidden objects have to be clearly defined. There were many HO that were too blurry to identify and there were a couple that  were miss named. 

This is the type of HOG game where when you are looking for an object, and then you think to yourself, "Hey I wonder if they think object X is really Y. And yes there were two or three times where an object was clearly mislabled. But not for adventurous clicking, I would not have got it.

Still, it was a nice casual game to play and I really enjoyed the game music. I've had  #2 & #3 in my library for a while but I waited until #1 came out on Steam before playing them.  I am intriqued enough to move on to the next games in the series.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972416553', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 253, 'playtime_forever': 222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 222, 'last_played': 1455725853}
review:
Easily one of the worst Hidden Object games I've played from Artifex Mundi. The usual odd poor word choice (or completely wrong word) on a few objects seems standard for all of their games, but one was a real corker in this one "cintra" for a lute? it's not even in my dictionary, no idea what they meant.. The music is quite nice, but terribly used and even overused to the point that I wanted to play without sound. 

Ok so the game. The story is terrible, with terrible acting, some of the worst and most unbelievable dialogue that exists within any medium. But it's a HO game, who cares about story right? The hidden object part is OK at best, but I did find it frustrating at times due to wrong words being used, and some of the pictures being so fuzzy and hard too see that even after finding them, I still wasn't very sure I had it right until I clicked and got it.
The Logic puzzles were all standard, and seem like 1 to 1 copies of puzzles already out there, and so added nothing new.
The Spot the difference was quite fun, haven't done that for a while.

But travelling around time is kinda fun. Worth 50 cents when looking to kill a few hours, but not much more. A low 5/10.

[h1] English [/h1]
Vivien went to visit her father to celebrate her achievement. However, she found a strange human figure on her way home and her father was abducted by a stranger. Thus, she went on athe journal to find her father.

Pros:
-Interesting concept (Time traveling)

Cons:
-Boring gameplay (Fixed pattern: find difference between pictures every time, mini-games are almost the same)
-Low quality of animations and graphics
-Nonsence lightness changing in hidden object scenes
-Limited connection to the sequel

review:
This game in one word? - TEDIOUS.
In more words?
lame graphics, more guessing than spotting the hidden objects, irritating light effects, pathetic voice acting and animation.
Weird and boring story. Phew.
The music was good, though, at times.
Definitely must be the first attempt at game making by Artifex. Luckily they got better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041556417', 'num_games_owned': 851, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 219, 'last_played': 1452431559}
review: I didn't really enjoy this game very much, but as it is one of this developers older titles, and since it's release they have done much better work I won't be too hard on this one. Overall some of this game was alright, the story was ok, the locations were decent. The strobing light in some of the areas where the Hidden object parts was incredibly annoying. Some of the puzzles were almost tough at points. Some achievements didn't work for me as well. Overall skip this one unless it's on a good sale, or your going through the series. I wish there was a neutral choice.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023850244', 'num_games_owned': 711, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 210, 'last_played': 1452833321}
review:
Awful game! Don't waste your money. The storyline was amazing -- for how horrid the voice acting and script were. It felt like it was tacked on the end just so they could claim to have voiceovers. The basic premise is interesting, but was handled so ham-fisted with people from the past apparently knowing all about time travel and treating it like an every day occurance. People you've never met before greet you by name.

I'm so glad Artifex Mundi went on to make much better games because if it had come down to this game as the last ditch effort to save the company, it would have gone under.

- Wiederkehrender Ablauf im Spiel - bleibt von Anfang bis Ende gleich (nur verschiedene Szenen)
- Grafik, Animation, Design und Voiceacting mittelmÃ¤ÃŸig bis schlecht; teilweise verpixelt
- Wimmelbildszenen [b]kÃ¶nnen[/b] mit der Zeit anstrengend fÃ¼r die Augen werden (Augenschmerzen)

[b]Zusammenfassung/Kommentar:[/b]

Eine Sache, die ich am Steam Reviewsystem nicht mag: Es gibt nur ja (empfehlen) und nein (nicht empfehlen). Aus meiner Sicht sollte es zumindest noch die MÃ¶glichkeit eingefÃ¼hrt werden ein Spiel als jein (ausgeglichen / oder-als-was-auch-immer) zu bewerten. 

Den dieses Spiel ist jein, wie einige andere Spiele auch. Es macht einige Sachen richtig gut und andere sind dagegen nicht so gut gelungen. GrundsÃ¤tzlich muss man hier wohl im Hinterkopf behalten, dass dieses Wimmelbildspiel eine Neuauflage eines der ersten Spiele von Artifex Mundi ist. 

Das, was dieses Spiel ausmacht (aber auch zur Qual machen kann) sind die Wimmelbildszenen. Zu einem GroÃŸteil besteht dieses Spiel aus Wimmelbildszenen und wenigen RÃ¤tseln. Wer ein solches Spiel sucht, wÃ¤re bei Time Mysteries genau richtig. Die Suchszenen scheinen auch schwieriger zu sein, als in spÃ¤teren Spielen von Artifex Mundi. Das scheint aber ein wenig mit der allgemeinen QualitÃ¤t zusammenzuhÃ¤ngen. Die Wimmelbildszenen wirken sehr Ã¼berladen. Viele GegenstÃ¤nde werden im Hintergrund oder bei anderen GegenstÃ¤nden verborgen â€“ meist farblich angepasst oder durchscheinender dargestellt. Die GegenstÃ¤nde sind aber nie so schlecht dargestellt, dass man etwas nicht finden kann. 
Allerdings habe ich feststellen mÃ¼ssen, dass die Suchszenen meine Augen mit der Zeit sehr belastet haben. Etwas das mir bei anderen Wimmelbildspielen nicht so stark ausgeprÃ¤gt passiert ist. 

Was die Grafik, Animationen und etc. angeht, bekleckert sich dieses Spiel wirklich nicht mit Ruhm â€“ und das ist, je nachdem wie streng man ist, noch hÃ¶flich ausgedrÃ¼ckt. Normalerweise stÃ¶re ich mich an der Grafik gerade bei Wimmelbildspielen wenig. FÃ¼r wenig Geld erwarte ich auch nicht so viel, die ganze Grafik muss aber zusammenpassen. Hier sieht alles sehr zusammengewÃ¼rfelt aus. Einige Szenen wirken wie gemalt, andere wie Ã¼berarbeitete Fotografien. Manche Sachen sind sehr verpixelt. 
Die Animationen hÃ¤tten sie besser ganz weglassen sollen. Beim Sprechen verzehrt sich der ganze Kopf. Manchmal verzehrt er sich aber so, dass der Mund verrutscht und man schwarze Stellen sehen kann. 

Und nun zu meinem Hauptkritikpunkt: der wiederkehrende Ablauf im Spiel. 
[olist]
    [*]Wimmelbild lÃ¶sen (Grund: Sachen finden aus der Zeit in die gereist werden soll.)
    [*]Zeitzone X angekommen: einige Wimmelbilder und ein RÃ¤tsel lÃ¶sen â€“> Ring finden
    [*]RÃ¼ckreise â€“ zum Abschluss Findet-den-Unterschied lÃ¶sen
    [*]Alles beginnt wieder von vorn[/olist]
Ich mÃ¶chte nicht zu sehr von der Story spoilern, daher nur soviel: Es mÃ¼ssen 7 Ringe wiederbeschafft werden und das alles nach oben erwÃ¤hnten Schema X. Daher fand ich das Spielprinzip recht eintÃ¶nig und einfallslos.

Das Review klingt nicht sehr positiv, dennoch habe ich es das Spiel ganz gern gehabt. Gerade weil es so viele, teilweise herausfordernde Wimmelbildszenen enthielt. 

[i][b]Fazit:[/b][/i] Dieses Spiel bekommt von mir gerade noch so eine Empfehlung, wenn man ein Spiel mit vielen und schwierigeren Wimmelbildern (und wenigen leichten RÃ¤tseln) sucht, dann probiert es ruhig aus. Bitte kauft es euch aber im Angebot. FÃ¼r den Vollpreis wÃ¼rde ich es nicht empfehlen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055712561', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 292, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 292, 'last_played': 1452457859}
review:
Grande fan des jeux du studio Artifex, de Point and Click et d'Hidden objects, c'est avec bonheur que je me suis offert le pack de la trilogie Time Mysteries sur Steam. MalgrÃ© les Ã©valuations variables, voire nÃ©gatives.

Ben j'aurais du un peu plus m'y fier.

C'est l'histoire de Vivian Ambrose, et de sa famille. C'est une histoire de voyages dans le temps, d'Ã©poques diverses et variÃ©es, d'Ã©nigmes, de sauvetage ... L'intrigue est bancale, trop simple, facile, mais Ã§a se pardonnerais assez vite si le reste suivait.

Mais on se contente de faire un tour dans la salle du temps, de faire une SOC (scÃ¨ne d'objets cachÃ©s), d'activer une porte temporelle, de passer 10min dans une Ã©poque (oÃ¹ tout le monde connais notre famille et notre secret de voyageur temporel ...), on fait quelques Ã©nigmes, quelques SOC, on rÃ©cupÃ¨re la bague et hop, retour Ã  la salle du temps, SOC, nouvelle Ã©poque.

Les personnages principaux ou secondaires ne sont pas attachants, seul le globe m'a un peu fait sourire, mais sans plus. Le Sonar est pratique pour voir Ã  quoi ressemble les objets qu'on cherche dans une SOC (scÃ¨ne d'objets cachÃ©s) surtout que celles ci sont franchement moches comparÃ©es Ã  ce que peux nous offrir Artifex ! Je n'ai pas vu trop d'erreur de traductions, ce qui Ã©vite de chercher une pipe et d'en fait trouver un tuyau (Pipe, pipe, vous saisissez?) Certaines SOC sont aurÃ©olÃ©es d'une lumiÃ¨re qui clignote, notamment dans la salle du temps, et c'est affreusement gÃªnant. Ã‡a ne donne pas un cÃ´tÃ© mystique, Ã§a donne juste envie de faire une crise d'Ã©pilepsie.

Bref, le jeu n'est pas trÃ¨s beau, il a une sorte de "grain" dÃ©rangeant, les Ã©nigmes sont correctes sans plus, les SOC brouillonnes (mÃªme pas besoin de regarder la liste d'objets Ã  trouver, ils nous sautent aux yeux tellement ils sont mal incrustÃ©s dans le dÃ©cor fixe) et il n'est au final pas trÃ¨s intÃ©ressant ...

Pour les fans du genre, prÃ©fÃ©rez les Nightmares from the Deep (le 3 est magnifique, trÃ¨s Pirate/Steampunk) ou Grim Legends.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972401055', 'num_games_owned': 1181, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 444, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 444, 'last_played': 1452201126}
review:
As far as hidden object games go, this one is pretty good.  There's a lot of hidden object puzzles throughout the game, and I assume that's why you're looking at this game, because that's what interests you.  There are approximately 30 hidden object puzzles in this game, and about ten "find the difference" puzzles.  If that's what interests you, then you won't regret this game.  

There's are some "adventure game" type puzzles, but they are really simple, and require very little backtracking.  There's a story that's not particularly interesting.  The characters are acted by voice actors that sound terribly amateur.  But none of that is going to take away from the hidden object and find the difference puzzles which are this game's bread and butter.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049991149', 'num_games_owned': 3565, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 272, 'last_played': 1452102877}
review: I'm a completist and as such I have this tendency to force feed myself some pretty horrible games just to get to better sequels in the series.  This one was one of those painful ones.  Halfway through I had to turn off the tiring voice audio which I never do, usually.  Perhaps there's a translation issue somewhere, but the writing was just as painful.  And obviously this game behaves like older Hidden Object games, nearly every turn there was another one with very little variation.  In many of the hidden object parts there were repeated items, for instance, in one a crown was required, but there were 2 crowns in the scene, and only one was the "correct" one.    Ultimately, I would say NO to this one, unless, like me, you get it in a bundle and just HAVE to complete the whole series.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077147190', 'num_games_owned': 1268, 'num_reviews': 219, 'playtime_forever': 239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 239, 'last_played': 1452091153}
review:
Ich hatte nicht sonderlich viel SpaÃŸ beim Durchspielen. Das Spiel soll ja "remastered" sein, aber gerade bei den Minispielen ist es sehr unausgereift. 

HÃ¤ufig weiÃŸ man bei den Minispielen nÃ¤mlich anfangs gar nicht, was man eigentlich machen soll. Es handelt sich dann oft um Spiele, bei denen man einfach nach dem Versuchs- und Irrtums-Prinzip rumklicken muss, bis es irgendwann passt. Am schlimmsten sind die beiden RÃ¤tsel, bei denen man so lange klicken muss, bis alle KnÃ¶pfe eingerastet sind bzw. leuchten. Das ist einfach nur frustrierend. 

Daneben gibts bei den Minispielen kleinere MÃ¤ngel. Bei einem Spiel muss man die passenden RitualgegenstÃ¤nde anklicken (das man das machen muss, findet man raus, indem man rumklickt). Witzig ist hierbei, dass der untere  Ritualgegenstand von der "Ãœberpringen"-Leiste verdeckt wird. 
Bei dem Apfelamulett muss man wiederum die Puzzleteile in dem Quadrat (!) so legen, dass die Schrift waagerecht ist. Ich hab Sie senkrecht angeordnet. Warum kann die Protagonistin nicht einfach das Quadrat drehen? Grrr ;-)

Richtig unfair wurde es gegen Ende des Spiels. Ich spiele Wimmelbildspiele gerne so durch, dass ich alle Achievements erreiche. FÃ¼r eines davon darf man in keiner Wimmelbildszene einen Tipp verwenden. Das ist ja kein Thema, die verwende ich eh nie in den Szenen. 
Sooo...blÃ¶d nur, dass man bei einem Zeitsprung gegen Ende des Spiels direkt in eine Wimmelbildszene geworfen wird, anstatt wie in den immer gleich ablaufenden ZeitsprÃ¼ngen davor stets in einer "normalen" Umgebung zu landen. Das habe ich leider nicht gemerkt. Ich klicke also auf die TÃ¼re, fahre mit dem Cursor herum, finde jedoch kein Symbol, das reagiert. Was muss ich also tun? Klicken wir mal auf "Hinweis"... 

Ich durfte das Spiel also nochmal spielen. Gott sei Dank konnte ich beim zweiten Durchlauf die Minispiele Ã¼berspringen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018496559', 'num_games_owned': 759, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 220, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 220, 'last_played': 1451202238}
review:
One of the worst hidden object games I've played, it very obviously shows its age.
Game revolves around a pattern that repeats itself in a very boring manner - find the ring, put it in the machine, do a "find the differences" game, search a room for object, place it on the machine, go through a door to find the next ring.
Puzzles are super easy, graphics are pretty poor, animations are hilariously bad.  Just don't waste your time, there are better HOGs out there.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971341065', 'num_games_owned': 3377, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 184, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 184, 'last_played': 1451076007}
review:
A generally competent and enjoyable hidden object game that has a few flaws, also the first installment in currently a trilogy of games all in the same vein.

So overall the gameplay is fine - the point and click sections are all fairly decently done, the puzzles are fairly varied but easy and not really challenging (for example we do a 4x4 knight move puzzle, except you can reuse the same squares over and over to cover all 16 squares, so you can't get lose), the hidden object scenes are mostly decent and playable with the exception mainly of the history archive which has this weird glow that fades in and out and made it difficult for me to look at the screen for long (kind of a problem for a hidden object game!)

In terms of the story it is fairly standard stuff, you are some amazingly special person that has to save the world using your time traveling abilities, everywhere in time you go everyone lavishing praise on you as one of the smartest people of all time, which you prove by solving one or two very simple puzzles. The structure also makes it a bit repetitive as you do exactly the same series of actions seven times as you recover each of the rings you drop at the start.

Other flaws for me include being British the protaganists accent was very annoying, but probably works fine for American audiences. Another being the weird non-animation of speaking characters where static images of their head kind of bulges and warps when they are speaking.

But overall this is perfectly playable and decent enough, although later entries in the series are somewhat better from what I remember, the main reservation I would have is the glow effect in the archive which did nearly get me to quit the game half finished a couple of times (and note you go to the archive seven or eight times in all)

author: {'steamid': '76561198084072724', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 270, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 270, 'last_played': 1450679475}
review:
I don't get the mixed reviews on this one. This is probably my favourite Artifex Mundi game I've played so far, and I've played quite a few.
It's bit old fashioned, but maybe that's why it's so likeable. 
I find the story really interesting - who doesn't like time travel? 
HO scenes are bit more challenging and that's great too. Maybe wouldn't recommend it for the asbsolute beginners in this genre for that reason.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972822414', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 412, 'playtime_forever': 176, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 176, 'last_played': 1450634753}
review: This is really not up to Artifex Mundi's usual standard so I am guessing it is a much older game. The artwork is not as good, some of the hidden object puzzles just look like they have pasted a load of random images over the background image then tried to put some fancy light effects over the top.  The voice acting is lacklustre, one of the characters sounds like the classically trained actor from Monkey Dust.  Some of the puzzles lacked necessary instructions, I'm thinking specifically of the Mastermind style puzzle where it didn't explain what the different pegs meant. Also the hidden object puzzles lacked precision there were a few places where two items that matched the item on the list and the puzzles seemed to list all musical instruments as flutes or fiddles. So all in all I'd give this one a miss and stick to the many other better examples of hidden object games produced by Artifex Mundi.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032800685', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 190, 'playtime_forever': 259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 259, 'last_played': 1450535504}
review: It saddens me giving a negative review to an Artifex Mundi game. Usually their works are the best, but this is obviously one of their oldest games and the only change that they made to this "remastered" version is to make the game playable on modern computer systems. The Hidden Object scenes are so badly detailed that some objects are almost unrecognisable and the few puzzles are too easy even playing in expert mode. Buy this only on sale or with a bundle.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027776061', 'num_games_owned': 1626, 'num_reviews': 145, 'playtime_forever': 259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 259, 'last_played': 1450146029}
review: Time Masters: Inheritance appears to be one of the earlier Artifex Mundi efforts and as such lacks the quality that the company would be later known for.  This game is by no means a terrible HOG, but it is a C- level game and I therefore cannot recommend it.  Try Artifex Mundi's other titles...  they're almost all good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026806776', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 302, 'playtime_forever': 104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1449986194}
review: [b]This[/b] is an Artifex Mundi game?  Really?  I've just come to expect so much more from them.  I think this is the first time I've ever voluntarily started playing the minigame alternative so I didn't have to hunt hidden objects.  The HO screens are all soft-focus and dull.  The minigames are dull.  The story is more holes than plot.  I was fighting my way through just for the sake of the achievements, and then decided that they weren't worth putting up with this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017843065', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 142, 'playtime_forever': 286, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 286, 'last_played': 1449348302}
review:
Remastered?
HO scenes largely plagued by fuzzy and out of focus items. The bleaching lighting effects in most scenes really annoyed and distracted me. The set up of the scenes was okay. There was a little repetition here and there.
The voice acting and script, which seems to have bothered others, was a highlight for me. I found it refreshing to see and hear 'proper' English. Soz :P
The story started out well, but I admit I had lost interest towards the end and 'skipped' to finish.
Achievements are super easy, most dropped as I was playing and I only had to focus on the time one. The puzzles were okay, I found them easy enough but I am rather good at those anyway.
Conclusion: The repeated focus and lighting problem prevents me from recommending this title.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971043455', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 246, 'last_played': 1465554995}
review:
I played part 3 before acquiring 1+2, and even though this game doesn't pose as much of a challenge as newer Artifex Mundi productions (low difficulty, less achievements), it is still a beautiful game (the soundtrack in particular stands out and the scenes have a tense atmosphere).

Still, there are two big downsides to the game:
[list]
    [*]The graphics are pixelated/washy (probably designed for a smaller screen resolution) and force-stretched from a 4:3 into 16:9. You would expect this to be different in a remastered version, right?
    [*]There are no directions given via text box in the puzzles, unlike in the screenshots that I have seen of the original! That means you either have to wild-guess what to do or consult an online manual/walkthrough. That's really annoying.
[/list]
Once you can overlook the graphics issue and get the hang of what to do in each puzzle, it's really a fun game to play, especially as part of the whole series.

author: {'steamid': '76561198215443113', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 162, 'last_played': 1448159264}
review:
Oh my god, this was crap! Not so much for the gameplay as such but for the story! Ok, no story of a hidden-object game would win a price, but the story of Time Mysteries: Inheritance makes absolutely no sense! You listen to the dialogs and think â€œWhat?â€ Sometimes the characters read the wrong lines and the voice acting as such makes the whole experience absolutely atrocious! 

Gameplayâ€¦ wellâ€¦ below averageâ€¦ I would have wished for the puzzles a description on what to do! About half of the time I just clicked and clicked until it made â€˜pingâ€™ and the puzzle was doneâ€¦ and I never figured out what the puzzle was about!

And then there were the hidden-object parts, where the light was fading in and out, that drove me nearly insane! Ok, I understand that it should make the game more challenging, BUT just the fading of light is nerve-racking! How about some other effects? Nope!

There are many absolutely fabulous hidden-object game out there, so donâ€™t buy this one!

author: {'steamid': '76561198087834803', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 228, 'playtime_forever': 335, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 200, 'last_played': 1522685053}
review:
Poorly designed and infuriatingly repetitive hidden object scenes. Hideous art that would have looked 10 times better if they'd kept the cutscenes as still images, rather than using this bizarre warping animation for lip movements. Voice acting ranges from campily enjoyable to "we pulled some random guy off the street and paid him in cheetos to do a single take blind reading of the script."

I gave the other two [i]Time Mysteries[/i] games thumbs down, but they were basically just inoffensively dull. [i]Inheritance[/i] is straight up terrible.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980246104', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 301, 'playtime_forever': 271, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1491671001}

author: {'steamid': '76561198109759317', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 231, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 231, 'last_played': 1445117119}
review:
Antiguo pero esta bien, el unico problema es que los personajes tienen problemas cerebrales, tales como que se les hincha la cabeza inexplicablemente al hablar. Bastante divertido y sencillo. Os aconsejo ponerlo en modo dificil y algunos apuntes: hay muchas cucharas, los caballos son caballeros y los cepillos son pinceles. Espero no haber hecho mucho spoiler del juego. 

Deseo que os guste el jueguillo.
Atentamente siempre vuestro GaNaPo
xoxo

review: Not bad for a hidden object game though not my favorite as some others did a better job overall with the presentation & external things beyond the hidden object parts. One big flaw on this is that there are many moments where the characters are talking and the way the animation is done just looks awful, easier for them to just have the talking bits & portraits pop up with the characters posed than talking here.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010597228', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 309, 'playtime_forever': 208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1442859074}
review:
Also fÃ¼r eine Remasterd-Version ist das echt ziemlich schlecht!

Story ist mies, Gameplay besteht aus fast nur Suchen und RÃ¤tseln, die einzelnen Epochen, in denen man Ringe sucht sind alle nach 10 Minuten durch und dazwischen muss man GegenstÃ¤nde suchen um in die Epochen reinzukommen und am Ende Fehler im Bild finden, wenn man einen Ring gefunden hat...

Sound und Grafik ist auch sehr mager...

Fazit: schlechtestes Spiel von dem Entwickler/Publisher bisher! Preis nicht gerechtfertigt!

author: {'steamid': '76561198052578775', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 558, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 203, 'last_played': 1658201320}
review:
It's an okay game overall, but not the best by Artifex Mundi. I love point and click in general, my favorites being by Artifex Mundi.  

The characters' animation is a bit wobbly, The story is pretty straightforward and it's too easy to know where to go next. This is all compared to other titles by Artifex Mundi. You want an ok point and click, get this one. You want a great one, buy any other by Artifex Mundi.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024972696', 'num_games_owned': 319, 'num_reviews': 262, 'playtime_forever': 280, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 280, 'last_played': 1441590769}
review:
Rating Artifex Mundi's "Time Mysteries: Inheritance - Remastered" is a bit of a poser.  It's a remastered version of an "older" game.  But, unless my Google-fu is letting me down, the original game came out in 2010.  So, we're not talking about an ancient game.  Anyway, the game is a casual adventure Hidden Object Game (HOG) and has its good side and its bad side.  For the good, there are a lot of HOGs and mini-games here, and they're much harder than normal (I guess that's good).  For the bad..., well:

- The story is pretty bad.  It's much worse than AM's norm.  Not only is the story silly, its "logic" breaks down by the end and there are all kind of holes in it.

- For the most part, the voice-acting, per-se, is adequate for the genre.  But, at the end, the voice acting of the "villain" is just awful.

- The animation in the main story is pretty bad.  When the characters talk, their mouths and lips don't necessarily move.  Instead, their whole heads deform like balloons.

- Even though this game has been "remastered," the end result is not even.  Speaking specifically of the HOGs, some of them are very nicely drawn, while others (the painting ones) are horrible.  In the horrible ones, you can't even make out what the items are that you're supposed to be finding.  Even in the non-horrible ones, the lighting and shading in some of the HOGs is bad enough that you can't even see that something exists in certain areas, let alone figure out what it is to click on it.

- All of the HOGs (badly rendered or not) are very busy and have very small items to find.  Also, the HOGs, themselves, are just about all unique.  There's a HOG you go through repeatedly, but the content changes (not just the items you're looking for - the actual pictures are different).  I can think of only one HOG that's used twice.  This makes getting the timed Achievement very difficult.  Remember, these are all busy scenes with tiny items to find.

- Almost all the mini-games are entirely lacking in instructions and goals.  Some of them are very hard to figure out what's even happening.

That's a lot of bad stuff for a game I'm still recommending.  But, even with the problems, I found the HOGs, in general, to be good.  They're definitely challenging.  But, if you're interested in the game, beware the pricing.  The current list price is about $10.  It took me 4.7 hours to get 100% Achievements.  So, I normally wouldn't pay more than $5 for it.  But, with the issues the game has, I'd look for it for even less.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120993683', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 281, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 281, 'last_played': 1440282214}

author: {'steamid': '76561198107888561', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 116, 'playtime_forever': 226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 226, 'last_played': 1440593936}
review:
De los que he ido probando sobre esta saga este por diferencia a sido el mÃ¡s malo de todos.
Graficos decentes
Animaciones malas
Musica mediocre
AmbientaciÃ³n mala
Historia pesima, sin sentido, a saltos.
Puzzles mediocres y basicos. Encima muchos son repetidos de otras sagas.
Juego corto, y encima es tan malo que lo unico que tienes ganas es de acabarlo.
Lo unico que te hartaras es de buscar objetos, y buscar diferencias en el mapa.
Nada recomendado este titulo.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970710846', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 143, 'playtime_forever': 280, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 280, 'last_played': 1440436707}
review:
Salut a tous !

Alors parlons de Time Mysteries: Inheritance - Remastered,

Ba pour un premier Ã©pisode c'est vraiment pas mal. L'histoire est bonne et assez captivante.

Les graphismes sont bons, avec des dÃ©cors colorÃ©s et variÃ©s, petit point faible, les animations des persos qui ressemblent plus a des dÃ©formations que des mouvements. Mais dans l'ensemble c'est propre.

La musique est bonne et les bruitage aussi, cotÃ© musical c'est un peut repetitif pour certaines mais ca passe.

Sinon ba comme dis plus haut c'est quand meme un Ã©pisode de la serie Artifex donc une valeure sure, et ca reste un bon jeux malgres ces petits defauts qui ne gachent en rien le gameplay ni l'histoire.

Donc pouce bleu quand meme hÃ©hÃ©, mais seulement pour les fans qui veulent combler leur bibliotheque, pour les autres je dirais de voir d'autres episodes qui sont plus palpitant cotÃ© story ;D

Venez jeter un oeil a mon groupe :
"[url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/steamsurprise]JEUX SURPRISE[/url]" la bas vous pourrez donner vos avis sur les Jeux Steam qui vous ont surpris et les partager entre gamer's ;D

Sur ce bonne recherches a tous XD
